title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:07 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:10 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:10 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
00:29 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:39 <jvdrean> has quit  
02:25 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
03:10 <npm> has quit  
03:13 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
03:13 <DrLou> has quit  
06:25 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:32 <AndreasJonsson> has quit  
07:57 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
07:57 <venkatesh> has quit  
08:02 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <jstoldt> good morning  
08:50 <@cjdelisle> good morning  
09:01 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <jvdrean> has quit  
10:00 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <lynxt> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <kwoot> is there something I should know about schema names when I connect xwiki to an oracle database?  
10:42 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <kwoot> i want to use xwiki\_owner as the main schema. is that a problem?  
10:43 <kwoot> anyone?  
10:44 <+tmortagne> kwoot: that's not really related to XWiki but more to Oracle directly, if Orcale support it that should be ok  
10:44 <kwoot> ok. thanks.  
10:45 <+tmortagne> you'r welcome :)  
10:51 <kwoot> as a sidenote: http://www.xwiki.com/xwiki/bin/view/Offer/Support?tab=tabber-header4&tabberIds=tabber-header#tabber-header4 does not function in google chrome 8.0. Just thought you'd like to know.  
10:54 <+tmortagne> kwoot: sure thanks  
10:57 <+tmortagne> kwoot: seems to work for me with chrome 9  
10:58 <+tmortagne> what does not work for you exactly ?  
11:00 <kwoot> +tmortagne: tabs do not change. si whatever tab I select, I see the same text. will try chrome 9.  
11:00 <+tmortagne> kwoot: ok indeed that works with chrome 9/ubuntu  
11:00 <kwoot> good to know. thanks.  
11:10 <jstoldt> added german translation for the XWiki Syntax to l10n.xwiki.org :)  
11:10 <jstoldt> yay me! ;)  
11:10 <@cjdelisle> awesome  
11:11 <jstoldt> hell of a job in the first place ;)  
11:11 <jstoldt> but then again... translation-fun X-D  
11:11 <@cjdelisle> heh, I write RFCs for fun ;)  
11:12 <+sburjan> :)  
11:12 <jstoldt> hehe  
11:24 <jstoldt> COMBO-BREAKER  
11:34 <jstoldt> who's responsible for the dashboard/gadgets stuff?  
11:35 <@cjdelisle> "Not I" said the cat...  
11:36 <jstoldt> ther aren't too many XWiki devs, i don't mind going excluding those that aren't in order to get to the one in charge  
11:36 <jstoldt> ;)  
11:37 <@cjdelisle> It's everyone but I think lucaa would be most knowlegable with questions about that.  
11:37 <@cjdelisle> ofc anyone might know so it's always a good idea to just ask.  
11:37 <+lucaa> yes jstoldt, what's up?  
11:37 <jstoldt> ah, hi, i noticed two weird strings  
11:37 <jstoldt> dashboard.actions.edit.differentsource.information  
11:38 <jstoldt> dashboard.actions.edit.differentsource.warning  
11:38 <+lucaa> ah, yes, they are weird on purpose  
11:38 <+lucaa> I mean I know they are weird  
11:38 <jstoldt> is there a mistake or do you really want to finish the first one with , and start the second one with .  
11:38 <jstoldt> okay  
11:38 <jstoldt> just wanted to make sure  
11:38 <+lucaa> yes, because they go together  
11:38 <+lucaa> did you see where they're used?  
11:38 <jstoldt> not at all  
11:39 <jstoldt> but why not use {0} kind of thing?  
11:39 <+lucaa> because I'm not calling that from velocity, but from a javascript  
11:39 <+lucaa> it's not that easy  
11:39 <jstoldt> ah, i see  
11:39 <+lucaa> (or at least I don't know how)  
11:39 <jstoldt> that's cool then :)  
11:39 <+lucaa> so indeed, there is a document link between them  
11:39 <+lucaa> (as you might have imagined)  
11:40 <jstoldt> yeah, figured it'd be something like that  
12:12 <+sburjan> Hello guys. I have a question: The validation done when creating a user when logged in as Admin, is it only client side or server side ? Because if I try to create a user that already exists, I get ok, and I get user already exists \_only\_ after pressing the add button  
12:13 <+sburjan> so this would indicate it's only client side validation.  
12:13 <+jvelociter> sburjan: you can't verify that client side  
12:13 <+jvelociter> only with an ajax request  
12:13 <+jvelociter> but we don't do it at the moment  
12:13 <+sburjan> I know, this is why I am asking, so it is intended behaviour, right ?  
12:13 <+sburjan> ok  
12:13 <+sburjan> thanks  
12:19 <kwoot> has quit  
12:19 <mflorea> has quit  
12:47 <kasun> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:32 <jstoldt> how can i check if an item has XWikiRights objects attached? trying #if($xwiki.getDocument("${request.space}.${item}").getObjects("XWiki.XWikiRights")) doesn't seem to work  
13:32 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:33 <@cjdelisle> It looks right, what I usually do is take it out of the if statement and see what it doe son it's own.  
13:33 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: getObjects -> getObject  
13:34 <jstoldt> tmortagne: but if want to delete those i need removeObjects, though, right?  
13:35 <jstoldt> yeah, getObject works  
13:35 <@cjdelisle> ahh I see, getObjects returns a vector even if there are none.  
13:35 <jstoldt> freaking velocity ;)  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> I like it since just putting $xwiki.getDocument("${request.space}.${item}").getObjects("XWiki.XWikiRights") on the page will make toString() get called on it and you can see what it is.  
13:37 <sburjan`> has quit  
13:37 <jstoldt> hehe  
13:37 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <@cjdelisle> so you'd see java.util.Vector@1234abcd when putting that into the page with no if statement  
13:38 <jstoldt> i see  
13:43 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <arkub> has quit  
13:58 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: hello. quick question. what other UI modifications does the "Enable extra accessibility features " besides highlighting links ?  
14:00 <walters> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <walters> hello, could somebody tells me what this line means?  [Statistics storing daemon] ERROR xwiki.RefererStatsStoreItem     - Failed to save referer statictics object [class com.xpn.xwiki.stats.impl.xwiki.RefererStatsStoreItem Stats.Visit http://xwiki.onvz.local/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Search?text=statistics&x=6&y=8 201102]  
14:09 <+tmortagne> walters: it means that XWiki failed to save statistics for some reason but impossible to say why with just that  
14:09 <+tmortagne> don't you have a stack trace or something after that ?  
14:11 <jstoldt> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison\_of\_wiki\_software << was TWiki really the predecessor of XWiki?  
14:11 <jstoldt> thought they were rather different...  
14:12 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: they are pretty different since it's not even the same technology but Ludovic was using TWiki when he decided to start  XWiki and the first version took a lot from TWiki AFAIK  
14:12 <jstoldt> ah, okay, i understand  
14:27 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: Bigger font  
14:28 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I can't notice it. I reall the issue I opened and told me only links didn't worked, but I can't see the font difference  
14:28 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: TWiki and XWiki even have the same URLs  
14:28 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: No, it was the other way around, IIRC, only the font size didn't work  
14:29 <jstoldt> they do? didn't know... never got much into it... i liked XWiki better so i pushed for that  
14:35 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: Now I understand. You didn't commit the fix on 2.7 branch. I think I'll re-open issue and put Affects:2.7.1 .. is it ok ?  
14:36 <+sburjan> it works on latest snapshot  
14:38 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: No  
14:38 <@sdumitriu> It's not critical for 2.7  
14:38 <+sburjan> I know  
14:38 <+sburjan> but I have to report everything doesn't work  
14:38 <+sburjan> for 2.7.1 more exactly  
14:52 <sburjan> has quit  
14:56 <kasun> has quit  
15:08 <walters> has quit  
15:36 <jstoldt> are there any good docs on the rights management?  
15:36 <jstoldt> i mean some that tell me in what order they are applied?  
15:42 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights#HAnoverviewofpermissions  
15:42 <jstoldt> thanks  
16:05 <jstoldt> out for the day  
16:05 <jstoldt> see you  
16:05 <jstoldt> has quit
